content.prompt:
© The Trustees of the British Museum / Art Resource, NY

The Hawaiian ‘ahu ‘ula (feather cape) shown reflects the high social status of its wearer through

choices.label: the combination of materials with male and female aspects
its references to the totemic species of a mythical hero
its use of vibrant dyes derived from sacred plants
the luxurious nature and divine symbolism of its materials

topic.text: 9.2: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Pacific Art

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain how and/or why context influences artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, and/or function in the creation or meaning of a work of art (or group of related works of art).
